Posts.Content: Hannah916 wrote: Hi everyone, I just had a lumpectomy done last Friday and my recovery has been pretty smooth.  I had clear margins and my sentinel nodes were negative, thank God!  But, my breast looks so weird now!  The top part, where I had the lump removed is now caved in and my surgeon said it should improve a little in appearance.  Can anyone share their experience so I know what to expect?  Thanks! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy Site Appearance Hannah916 kcpc

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2007 09:49AM Hannah916 wrote: Shannon, Determined- I was thinking about reconstruction as well after radiation but the thought of more surgery is sooo abhorrent to me right now.  Maybe I'll feel differently in another year.   Determined is right Shannon, whatever you decide is going to be the right thing for you.  Afterall, surgery is a breeze, you go to sleep and wake up and it's all over.  Recovery on the other hand is no cake walk, but you've been through it before and for the most part, you know what to expect.  You can get through it!  If you decide not to, well, there's nothing wrong with a little mixed match set, right?  Afterall, symmetry is over-rated!  Most important thing?  You're cancer free and healthy!!
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy Site Appearance Hannah916 kcpc

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2007 04:29PM Hannah916 wrote: Thanks everyone for your comments.  It seems silly to be focusing on the appearance considering everything but, right now my boob doesn't feel like mine yet.  It's still sensitive to the touch and a little hard so it feels a bit alien to me.  I'm sure it will get better and it helps knowing that there are others out there who are going through the same thing.  Thanks for your encouragement, I really appreciate it!!
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy Site Appearance Hannah916 kcpc

Posts.Content: Hannah916 wrote: Hi everyone! Does anyone have any information about concerns over air travel after radiation?  I'm due to start radiation soon and I have a vacation planned two weeks after I finish my treatments.  I'm wondering if I should give myself more time to recuperate before flying.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Air Travel after Radiation Hannah916 JukieF

Posts.Content: Hannah916 wrote: Hi everyone.  I just completed 28 of 33 rad treatments and I have five more boosts to go.  My skin held up pretty well except for the redness and the pores!  The pores really freaked me out though.  They turned brown and you can see each and every pore on my breast!  Has anyone else experienced this particular side effect?  How long did it last?  I heard this is one of the longer term side effects which may take up to a year to go away.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Brown Pores! Hannah916 Sooze
